data.title: Mixed experiences
data.text: Get there early for best selections, but I guess that's true for most small bakeries. Quality is good but varies between batches. Blueberry scones, for example, can be really tasty or a bit overly dry. I don't know if this is related to certain bakers or the time of day. But if you want something out of the ordinary as a breakfast or coffee treat, Mike's may be convenient...only a few blocks from the freeway with truly homemade selections, unlike the chain coffee store at the start of this shopping strip mall.

data.title: So fresh - wonderful cakes and pastries
data.text: Have probably tried 9 or 10 different cakes through the years and each has been delicious!  Love the strawberry-filled w whipped cream frosting, and their cake with lemon curd filling is heaven!  Not cheap but when exquisite pastries are this good - I'll pay for it. I think the fruit pies are typical. Cakes and breakfast offerings are exceptional. Order a day ahead - don't take the chance you favorite will be there!  Christmas Yule log is yummy!

data.title: Brithday Cake delight
data.text:
Had the Strawberry Cream Cake on my bothers birthday.
I was amazing.
If like this type of Cake, I don't thing you will be disappointed at all

data.title: OLD FASHION BAKER WHO REALLY CARES
data.text:
My daughter wanted a beautiful birthday cake something with ribbons and bows, in her favorite colors. I needed it custom. And I needed it delivered on the day of her birthday party.
That is exactly what I got!!
And everyone that was involved in the ordering to the delivery were like the old fashioned bakers who really care about people, just made us feel so loved, warm and fuzzy and happy to have the most beautiful birthday cake in the world for our little princess. And to top it all off the cake and frosting are still the talk of all our friends! 
We are making sure to order our Aunt and Uncles Wedding Anniversary cake from Mickes.
Bye the way want a delicous fresh cupcake or frosted cookies that just came out of the over, or how about a just out of the over danish pastry. That is why we always buy from Mikes Pastry Shop.

data.title: Mike's
data.text: Mike's has a special cake you can have it in white or chiffon cake. They can put pineapple, strawberries and banana's in it. Also has whipped cream frosting. It's the bomb!!! A little pricey but worth it. A favorite at our house. There are other items as well that are pretty tasty but this is a favorite.

data.title: Soooo Yummy!
data.text: Everything in the stop is homemade. They have sweet and savory pastries. There chocolate croissants are the best!

data.title: Delicious delights!
data.text: Mike's Pastry Shop hits it out of the sweet park with every single offering. From pleasing pastries to yummy cookies to spectacular speciality cakes, this bakery is the place to go. A friendly and efficient staff with a "we-can-do-it" attitude, you can't go wrong here. My favorites: The fudge brownies, butter horn pastry and the shortbread cookies. They also offer some can't-be-beat savories like pot pies and breads. It's literally the tastiest place around!

data.title: My anniversary cake
data.text: The cake was super moist and the lemon filling was great.  This cake reminds of the cake my sister had at her wedding so my daughter orders me and husband one e very year

data.title: I ate the cake
data.text:
I was at a party not to long ago and couldn't stop eating the cake.
Wonderful icing and creamy filling Chocolate Cake

data.title: Fantastic bakery in Antioch!
data.text: This bakery is really fantastic. The pastries, cookies and cakes are up to par with bakeries in wine country and San Francisco. The prices are reasonable too. There is a chain coffee shop two doors down that is always busy while this amazing bakery is not getting much attention. Skip the chain coffee shop and go a couple doors down to have a regular cup of coffee with fresh amazing pastries for the same price. You will not be disappointed. I just got a cake here recently and it was very good too and only around $27 for an 8 inch round white cake with raspberry filling with buttercream icing. It was so good. You'll never want a grocery store cake again after you get one from here. Please try this place out. It's a local business with great pastries in a town loaded with chain businesses. You usually have to travel far for this quality.

data.title: Run...Don't Walk.. For Great Baked Goods!
data.text:
RUN...don't walk... past Starbucks on "A" St...to Mike's Pastry Shop if you want really good breakfast pastries to eat with your coffee. This morning I was headed for the SB when I had to park a little further down the strip mall because the limited parking in front of SB was full. I wound up in front of Mike's. It almost looked closed because of the dark (too dark) sun shading on the windows but the little neon sign said "OPEN" so I thought, "what the heck...let me go see what they have". I didn't want to stand in line for coffee and some pastries anyway and there was no one in Mike's.  

Admittedly it's been a while since I've been in this little local bakery...more than a couple of years. Not even sure if it's the same owners because I noticed one of the showcases, that was once filled with cakes and pastries, was covered over with a sheet or tablecloth and all of their goods were in the first 2 cases. Looks like they've cut down on some of their variety. 

Anyway, I looked around a little and found one of my favorite treats...Apple Danish. They only had 2 left so I bought them both along with an Almond Raspberry Tart for my husband. I also picked up a few of their GORGEOUS muffins...a Double Choc, Fresh Peach, Lemon and Maple Bacon to bring to my breakfast meeting. 
OMG!!  Everything was so good!  Everything I bought was wiped out..I was lucky to get 1/2 of my Apple Danish and a bite of a muffin (the fresh peach was to die for!)....everyone loved them and kept asking where I bought this delicious stuff. Someone even ate my husbands Almond Tart!  

I am just amazed that the Starbucks, just a few doors away, was so busy and this lovely, delicious bakery was empty. Their baked goods are no more expensive but are just so much better. They are fresher tasting and seem to be made with higher quality ingredients. They also sell coffee and have tables & chairs inside for people to sit.
I am definitely going there for all my baked goods from now on. My next purchase will be a birthday cake for the hubs. All the cakes and pastries in the case looked delicious...especially the Chocolate Mocha Cake, which is what I will order. Have no idea of prices but if they are as good as what I've tried already, I know it will be well worth it.
Just as a note, I was in at about 9:30 am and they didn't have a whole lot of breakfast pastries left. Not sure if they had already been really busy or if they just don't make a lot because they're not that busy and are trying to avoid waste. So, I would say if you want more than just 1 or 2 items you should call in advance and order it or get there early...you won't be sorry!

TRY this place people! Don't let the only independently owned, made from scratch, REAL bakery in Antioch go away due to lack of business. These are the kinds of businesses we need to support as a community to keep our neighborhoods thriving and to give us the choices we deserve.   Otherwise all we have are grocery store, corporate chain, mass produced, mediocre stuff to choose from....like it or not.
